content:
both programs are adding new staff and expanding initiatives PERIOD

by  Theresa MuellerPublished  September  

To keep up with the high demand of mental health services for students The University of Minnesotas Boynton Mental Health Services and Student Counseling Services are expanding hiring new staff and enlarging existing programs PERIOD

In addition to hiring four new therapists Boynton is offering extra workshops for students to learn how to cope with things like stress anxiety or depression PERIOD Student Counseling Services has also added new staff members as the request for counseling continues to increase PERIOD To reach more students across campus additional counselors have been embedded into Carlson School of Management and the College of Liberal Arts counseling services PERIOD

We are all responsible for the health and wellbeing of the students said Jerry Shih interim director for Student Counseling Services PERIOD

Steve Hermann director of Boynton said there is not a single explanation for the increased demand for mental health services PERIOD A combination of a destigmatization of mental health and rising levels of diagnosed anxiety stress and depression are all reasons for the increase in traffic he said PERIOD

Boynton has seen issues with waitlists in the past due to the increase of requests for services Hermann said PERIOD Students are waitlisted if they cannot schedule an appointment within two weeks PERIOD The new therapists were added to help reduce wait times PERIOD

Access is not strictly getting in the door Hermann said PERIOD Access is also about whether students can be seen with the frequency that addresses their needs. with more hires and additional space Boynton is offering more group therapy sessions in an effort to help students feel comfortable talking with students with similar experiences PERIOD

Group therapy sessions are additional resources that help meet the spectrum of demand Hermann said PERIOD

Michelle Krypel coordinator for group therapy sessions said group therapy can be an empowering experience for students as it can be validating to know other students are going through similar issues PERIOD

We want to make sure everyone there will benefit Krypel said PERIOD

To provide services beyond formal counseling SCS is expanding the Lets Talk program this fall PERIOD

The program allows students to attend dropin sessions PERIOD Previously Lets Talk was only offered at one location but it has expanded to eight locations across the Twin Cities campus PERIOD

The aim for the program has been to reach students who would not normally come into the Student Counseling Center Shih said PERIOD The program targets underrepresented and marginalized students by offering additional services and group sessions PERIOD

Despite the expansion of programs and additional staff Shih said there are still limitations in the mental health services PERIOD

There are always resource limits  we are always looking within restrictions Shih said PERIOD
